Gojek is an equal opportunity workplace that is committed to diversity and inclusion. At Gojek we celebrate our differences, because we believe that diversity not only creates a healthier work environment for our employees, but also helps our business thrive. 



About us

Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!
lever.description:
About the team
The Group Program Manager for People and Culture, Corporate is part of the Program Management team, but the role (and all direct reports) are embedded within the People and Culture (PAC) team to closely collaborate on a daily basis with the PAC  team and senior leadership.

The People and Culture department focuses on building and supporting our growing team to help them reach their personal and business goals. The team is responsible for corporate talent, organisational development and transformation across Gojek. 

The Program Management (PgM) organization was formed in 2019 and focuses on building and supporting the growing Gojek team to help them achieve business, product and personal goals. We connect the dots between the teams working on transformational projects, initiatives, and programs to ensure that everyone has what they need to succeed. 

About the role:

The Group Program Manager (PgM) is part of a small senior leadership group within Program Management and reports directly to the Global Head of Program Management.  In this role, you will serve as a trusted, strategic advisor to senior management in assessing business opportunities, strategy, and team health/morale. 

This is a working manager role that will be responsible for establishing team quality standards and a learning curriculum to perpetuate and instill excellence within the Program Management function. You will have up to six senior Program Managers direct reports. 

As the Group Program Manager for the People and Culture, Corporate team you are ultimately responsible for the overall success of the entire Program Management team, which includes your direct reports and their corresponding direct reports of up to six people per department. A key objective is to ensure that the plans and priorities created by your direct PgM reports and the PgM organization are effectively coordinated and executed—all in the midst of a fast pace of change. Additionally, you will act as a mentor to the PgM team by architecting strategies for career growth goals, speaking as the voice of experience, and ensuring operational excellence. 

The role requires deep functional expertise and will play a critical part in driving operational rigor to grow programs and projects in both the PgM org and across the company from an inception stage to a scaled and stable execution. The role will be responsible for implementing and operationalizing Program Management programs for the PgM org and other vital team functions as necessary across all Gojek offices in Indonesia, India, and Singapore and beyond. Your primary internal stakeholders will be the People and Culture leadership team, the Program Management org and people partners/human resources.  

You will also be a point of contact between the execution team, cross-functional stakeholders, and leadership. It will be the Group PgM’s ultimate responsibility to drive collaboration between all parties involved in order to prioritize, schedule and deliver on time.

lists.content:
• Exhibit excellent critical thinking skills around new initiatives to foresee issues and resolve them before problems reach a critical stage. 
  • Address gaps and inefficiencies across the organization, while supporting the growth and evolution of the PgM function. 
  • Act as a thought leader to your team while overseeing the design of project execution plans in close collaboration with leads from multiple cross-functional teams. Maintain momentum across the team to keep projects on track.
  • Showcase empathetic leadership and vision in managing your direct reports and collaborating with other employees.
  • Prioritize when all projects, programs, or issues are deemed “urgent” by assessing what will have the most positive impact on the business while weighing it against other projects/programs.
  • View programs and roll-out through the lens of scaling on a global level by utilizing  tools, roadmap, and processes.  
  • Build stronger collaboration between our offices, help to reconcile country-specific operational differences and create flexible processes that can be adapted to each location.
  • Working hours and time zone adaptability. The role will require time shifting on a weekly/monthly basis to collaborate and virtually meet with teams based in various regions around the globe.
  • Navigate a global, matrix-organization and while maintaining positive, authentic relationships.
  • Be willing to dive into the trenches and have a “no job too small” mentality.

• Min 10 years of experience in program and/or project management
  • Executive level experience managing, mentoring and supporting a team of direct reports
  • Demonstrable track record of managing large-scale & complex rollouts end to end
  • Ability to quickly ramp up on new concepts to keep up with the changing environment
  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills focused on improving collaboration, understanding & information exchange across all stakeholders to creative and technical teams alike.
  • Highly experienced in synthesizing data and providing analytics-driven insights
  • Fluent in English

• Experience in change management for multiple functions and geographies
  • Asana experience

• You are organized, efficient, and detail-oriented. You manage your time efficiently, and use tools to help others do the same. You obsessively record decisions, follow up on action items, and create easy-to-digest documentation. You tend to foresee edge cases in technical specs and identify risks before they become too painful to address. 
  • Communication is your superpower. You have a passion for connecting people to the information and processes that make them feel taken care of. People know that you have things under control, whether it’s keeping people on the same page across multiple continents, or coordinating a sensitive launch with multiple department heads. You can express complicated situations to people who have no idea what you’re talking about, and can lay out the hard truths without causing an uproar.
  • You are extraordinarily mindful and self-aware. You are an active listener and have deep empathy for the people around you. You are tuned into their motivations and worries, and you use that understanding to compassionately help them overcome obstacles. It’s intuitive for you to read signals that help you decide when to follow up, and when to give space to others. You seek to understand both the business’ point of view and the technical constraints that keep your engineers up at night. You know your strengths, but you own your mistakes and know when to ask for help.
  • Your passion for process is grounded in pragmatism. You naturally find repeatable patterns and transform them into reusable workflows for everyone else. But you reject the idea of having process for process’ sake — your goal is to find ways to make things run more efficiently, and sometimes that means changing (or killing) a process. 
  • You are balanced and well-rounded. On this team, you’re expected to be a big-picture thinker and strategic partner. But you’re also willing to get your hands dirty and do whatever it takes to help your team deliver high-quality work against tight deadlines. You’re passionate about using your combined technical, software engineering and business process acumen to deliver good solution. 
  • You are not fazed by ambiguity and pressure. Conversely, you embrace the opportunity to translate chaos into excellence. You patiently and confidently weave threads of confusion into clear and actionable steps. You inspire confidence and calmness in the face of uncertainty, and you shield your team members from the storm so that they can focus on execution.
